ygData.subject: Re: Farewell Atlantis
ygData.msgSnippet: Lord Perseus turned to his new comrade. From various encounters over the years, we ve learned that Unicron visited this world long ago.  At that time he

Lord Perseus turned to his new comrade.

"From various encounters over the years, we've learned that Unicron
visited this world long ago.  At that time he decided not to extract
this planet's energon, instead leaving his minions to prepare it for
his return.

"These minions lay dormant for so long that we were far more concerned
with factional fighting.  The Predecons, ideological descendants of
the decepticons, and we Maximals, essentially autobots, have been
fighting ever since we first settled here.  However, when the minons
re-emerged; my maximal brethren seens content to allow the minion
threat to grow unchecked, while carrying out their petty grude-matches
with the Preds.

"That is when we broke into factions.  Things didnt get better, the
fighting was worse than before.  Roughly one mega-cycle ago, we
underwent a heavy minions incursion, including several large-scale
attacks on Atlantis.  This is the reason we have left.  The
Unicronians wont bother with a sparcely populated island.  We should
give them a big, populated and heavily fortified target.

For now, we are at a lull in the storm, but we know that the minion
forces are increasing.  Hydras at least has come to his senses and has
agreed to a truce; I can only hope Lord Razorwing has had a change in
attitude since we last spoke."

On 8/26/09, magicquartz <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> Tucson remains beside Lord Perseus, curious to find out what he might have
> missed during his forced stasis and re awakening. Apparently it was quite a
> bit.
>
> " Lord Perseus, I'm afraid I don't understand fully as to what is going on..
>  I'm too quick to blame the Decepticons for what's happening.  I've missed
> quite a bit during my forced stasis which I have no idea as to how long I'd
> been off line.  When I came to Atlantis, I was just looking for a place
> where I could recover and try to forget the wounds of war.  For a long time
> I did.  Then, I started finding curious artifacts around the island and
> found solace in restoring them.  I - guess I hate to see things being
> destroyed, when I know how long it takes to make them.  I've kept myself in
> the dark far too long, and I'd like to know what's happening and for what
> reason it is happening.  Once I understand what I've been missing, I assure
> you I'll help you to the greatest of my abilities."
>
> He turns his head in the direction of the  front of the ship, where he can
> hear the hum of the equipment.
>
> " Even if it means putting my own spark at risk."
>
> He remains close by to Lord Perseus, doing what Autobots do best. Serve and
> protect the innocent.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
>>
>> As they came into range of Relay City, Perseus put out a radio
>> transmisson on all maximal frequencies.
>>
>> "This is Lord Perseus to all maximals.  What is your status?  We
>> havent heard from you in quite some time." he said.  "I know we have
>> had our disagreements in the past, but let's put that behind us for
>> now."
>>
>> He looked to the others in the shuttle, some nodded in aproval.  He
>> was tired, and he thought the others were two.  This would continue to
>> be a difficult time for them he thought.
>>
>> On 8/20/09, magicquartz <magicquartz@...> wrote:
>> > Tucson walks up to Perseus and puts a hand out to feel where he is
>> > exactly.
>> > He confirms that he is up near the front of the ship, by the feel of
>> > it's
>> > hull, and structure of the airtanker.  A narrowed brow shows an air of
>> > suspicion and still an air of dislike for the Decepticons who had left
>> > him
>> > with a bad taste in his mouth and then some.
>> >
>> > " It just doesn't seem natural that a Tsunami would just build up out of
>> > nowhere.  Ohhh they talk of peace, but how can we believe a Decepticon's
>> > word when all they've ever done was destroy whatever they set foot on?
>> > Lord Perseus, I don't want to jump to conclusions, and I could be wrong
>> > but
>> > this doesn't appear to me as an act of Nature alone.  It's as if
>> > something
>> > or someone wanted to target Atlantis.  I'm sorry, but it will be a cold
>> > day
>> > in the universe before I ever trust a Decepticon."
>> >
>> > Being a critical sort, he could not help but express his opinion about
>> > the
>> > Decepticons and the so called peace treaty that was in progress.
>> >
>> > " I promise, I will not interfere with any negotiations we may have with
>> > the
>> > opposing sides.  Just - please, do not count on my support when it comes
>> > to
>> > the Decepticons."
>> >
>> > He continues to stand at the front of the airtanker, trying to listen to
>> > get
>> > an idea of where they were at the present time.
>> >
>> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@> wrote:
>> >>
>> >> After everyone had boarded, the shuttle and air tankers lifted off.
>> >>
>> >> "Pilot, take us to Relay City.  I want to confirm the condition of the
>> >> Maximal Base."  he said.  "It's been while since I last heard from
>> >> Razorwing, I hope he's all right."
>> >>
>> >> "And what of Lord Elder and the Ark?" asked Salveo, who had been at
>> >> the ark when the tsunami struck.  "I know they have a few defenders,
>> >> including that mysterious Legacy.  But I feel bad leaving him there."
>> >>
>> >> "As soon as we have relocated, we will make the ark our top priority."
>> >> Perseus replied.  "Well, that and figuring out what those Unicronians
>> >> are planning."
>> >>
>> >> The aircraft flew in formation and banked to the west, in the
>> >> direction of Relay.
>> >>
>> >> OOC:  Anyone who was in Atlantis and missed these posts can choose to
>> >> resume with the Maximals or by themselves in Atlantis.
>> >>

>> >> > On 8/7/09, Sandy <magicquartz@> wrote:
>> >> >> It would be hard to leave Atlantis. Tucson had found many joys
>> >> >> living

>> >> >> it would harm the people. He transforms out of his SUV mode and

>> >> >> pauses for a moment to hear if anyone was around him, to be sure

>> >> >> he

>> >> >> but
>> >> >> to
>> >> >> serve faithfully. I will be joining you. "

>> >> >> lord.
>> >> >>
>> >> >> " My name is Tucson, and as I explained earlier, I'm an Autobot,
>> >> >> ready
>> >> >> and
>> >> >> willing to serve you faithfully."

>> >> >>> > > > > eye

>> >> >>> > > > > the

>> >> >>> > > > > be

>> >> >>> > > > > the
>> >> >>> > answer.
>> >> >>> > > > >

>> >> >>> > > > > merely aggrivates conditions. Without us, this island would

>> >> >>> > > > > a

>> >> >>> > > > > our research together; and I promise we will do anything we

>> >> >>> > > > > to
>> >> >>> > > > > help the city."
